attributes.action: form a commons review by the Home Secretary on the current abuse of the court system by banks, building societies and other fiduciary services in the UK when dealing with customers on 'unfair bank charges' claims
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This petition is asking that the Prime Minister establish a commons review panel to look into the ongoing issue of UK fiduciary services abusing the UK legal system by forcing legal action through courts when they have no intention of completing the legal route from the outset.  Currently this is causing courts to become clogged with cases that will never make it to court, and so ask that this is investigated to review whether the government can action changes to stop the legal system being used as a delaying and bullying tactic by large organisations on smaller organisations or individuals.
